results.title: The Navigator
results.brief_description: Buster “Keaton moves in the mechanised world of today like the inhabitant of another planet. He gazes with frozen bewilderment at a nightmare reality. Inventions and contrivances like deck chairs and railroad engines seem insuperably animate to him, in the same measure that human beings become impersonal.” Arthur Mayer. In “The Navigator”, which grossed more than any other Keaton film, it was a huge luxury liner. There is the famous sequence in which Keaton gloomily sets about cooking his breakfast, in a ship’s galley equipped to feed five hundred people. Painfully, he times an egg as it boils in a huge cauldron. The plot of “The Navigator” inverts the problem of Robinson Crusoe. Crusoe had to create the rudiments of civilisation on a desert island. Keaton, playing a dim-witted millionaire, finds himself and his girl marooned in an over-technical environment. He has to create the basis for crude existence. Considered by many Keaton buffs to be the funniest film he ever made.

results.title: Muscle beach
results.creator_credit: Strick Film Company, J Strick and I Lerner
results.brief_description: A humorous and poetic impression of the pursuit of physical culture on the San Monica Beach, California. The languor’s of a summer afternoon are contrasted satirically with the fervours of the body builders and devotees of physical exercise.

results.title: A Moment in love
results.brief_description: A ballet choreographed by Anna Sokolow and designed for camera by Shirley Clarke, featuring movements and images physically impossible to perform on stage. Depicts the passion between two lovers who meet in the clouds and move through a world of fantasy. The dancers are Carmela Gutierrez and Paul Sanasardo. Music, Norman Lloyd. Cinematography, Bert and Shirley Clarke. A film without commentary.

results.title: Moliere
results.creator_credit: Elvire Chessin, Norbert Tildian and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: The world and environment of Moliere portrayed in 17th century drawings and paintings. His satirical comedies “Tartuffe”, “Les Ecole des Femmes”, “L’Avarre” and “Le Bourgeois Gentilhomme” are discussed. Several scenes from the plays, spoken in French, are incorporated. The actors are from La Comedie Francaise. Main commentary in English.

results.title: The Metamorphosis of Mr Samsa
results.brief_description: Inspired by Franz Kafka’s short story of alienation and grief Metamorphosis, this animated film communicates through images of sand and sound what Kafka expressed through words. Simple materials are used with subtlety and precision to create the sad plight of human angst. From ordinary beach sand spread on a piece of glass, Caroline Leaf produces the tragic world of Gregor Samsa, half man. half insect.

results.title: The Merry-Go-Round
results.creator_credit: John Kemeny, ONF | NFB and Tanya Ballantyne
results.brief_description: A provocative opening to a discussion of youth and sexual ethics. What are adolescents saying and doing about sex now they have shaken the old taboos, but when their new morality is still far from certain?

results.title: Meditation on violence
results.brief_description: A study of a dancer in which the dance movements follow, in general, the sequence which has, for several centuries, been in traditional training usage of two schools of Chinese boxing - the Wu-tang and Shao-Lin. Performed by the dancer, Ch’ao-Li Chi, the dance in this film is accompanied by music played on the Chinese flute and Haitian drums. No commentary, music only.

results.title: A Matter of conscience: Henry VIII and Sir Thomas More
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Western Civilization”.
An edited version of ‘A Man for All Seasons’ concentrating on the historic clash between Henry VIII and Sir Thomas More as a prototypical confrontation between the power of the state and the individual who chooses to oppose it.

results.title: Man of Aran [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Sir Michael Balcon, Rank Organisation Film Productions, GB Film Library and Robert Joseph Flaherty
results.brief_description: Extract from the Gaumont British production. The Man of Aran is seen with his two companions…Mikeleen is awakened by the sounds of the rising storm. Mideleen and his mother watch the flimsy craft battling for the shore. The men leap to safety but the sea drags the curragh boat back and smashes it. Man of Aran and his family return homewards.

results.title: The Magic of Walt Disney world
results.creator_credit: Ron Miller, Walt Disney Productions and Tom Leetch
results.brief_description: Disneyland was the prototype for this larger, more advanced amusement park in Florida. The range of attractions for the tourist are accordingly diverse and spectacular, from the Polynesian Village to the monorail ride and the Fort Wilderness camping ground.
